Containers.Name: malfurious-letsencrypt
Containers.Description: This docker is designed to be used with malfurious-mailserver, malfurious-postfixadmin, malfurious-roundcube, and malfurious-redis. Under PostArgs, change the "domain.td" section to your desired domain, and add or remove "-d subdomain.domain.td" to fit your needs. If using with malfurious-mailserver etc., use all subdomains listed, and make sure mail.domain.td is the first domain listed. Also, change the volume host path to the /certs folder under your Nginx docker. Also, add the /etc/letsencrypt volume to your mailserver docker that points to the same nginx /certs folder.
Containers.Overview: Malfurious-LetsEncrypt is an SSL Certificate generator using LetsEncrypt.
Containers.PostArgs: certonly --standalone --rsa-key-size 4096 --agree-tos -m contact@domain.td -d mail.domain.td -d webmail.domain.td -d postfix.domain.td -d spam.domain.td
